# Data Analysis for questions 8 and 9

```{r load data breweries.csv, beers.csv and import library }

library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
library(dplyr)
breweries <- read.csv("~/Documents/SMU/DS6306 Doing DS/CaseStudy1_2_2_2_2_2-2/Breweries.csv")
beers<- read.csv("~/Documents/SMU/DS6306 Doing DS/CaseStudy1_2_2_2_2_2-2/Beers.csv")
```

```{r transform data beers.csv}
beers2 <- beers
colnames(beers2)
names(beers2) <- c("beername", "beerID", "beerABV", "beerIBU", "beer.brewery.id", "beerstyle", "beerOunce")
head(beers2)

```

```{r transform data breweries.csv}
brew2 <- breweries
colnames(brew2)
names(brew2) <- c("brewery.id", "brewery.name", "brewery.city", "brewery.state.abb")

brew2 <- brew2 %>%
  mutate(brewery.state.abb = trimws(brewery.state.abb))

head(brew2)

```

```{r}
library(class)
library(caret)
library(e1071)
#create a beerclassify data with beercombined_ale form

beerclassify <- beercombined_ale %>% 
  filter(!is.na(beerABV) & !is.na(beerIBU))

beerclassify %>%
  group_by(beeripaale) %>%
  summarize(beers.abv.median = median(beerABV), beers.ibu.median = median(beerIBU), count = n())


beerclassify %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = beerABV, y = beerIBU, color =  beeripaale)) + 
  xlab("ABV") + ylab("IBU") + 
  geom_point()
  
#use KNN classification to investigate the difference with respect to IBV and ABU between IPA and ALE
set.seed(300)
split.perc = .70


train.indices = sample(1:dim(beerclassify)[1],round(split.perc * dim(beerclassify)[1]))

train = beerclassify[train.indices,]
test = beerclassify[-train.indices,]

dim(beerclassify) 
dim(train) 
dim(test)
#original
classifications = knn(train[,c(4,5)],test[,c(4,5)], train$beeripaale, prob = TRUE, k = 10)
confusionMatrix(table(test$beeripaale,classifications))

# compare it with the above original one
classifications = knn(train[,c(16,17)],test[,c(16,17)], train$beeripaale, prob = TRUE, k = 17)
confusionMatrix(table(test$beeripaale,classifications))


```


## Loop for many k and one training / test partition
```{r}
acc = data.frame(accuracy = numeric(30), k = numeric(30))

for(i in 1:30)
{
  classifications = knn(train[,c(16,17)],test[,c(16,17)], train$beeripaale, prob = TRUE, k = i)
  table(test$beeripaale, classifications)
  CM = confusionMatrix(table(test$beeripaale,classifications))
  acc$accuracy[i] = CM$overall[1]
  acc$k[i] = i
}

plot(acc$k,acc$accuracy, type = "l", xlab = "K Value", ylab="Accuracy")

```
## Loop for many k and many training / test partitions
```{r}

set.seed(100)
iterations = 100
numks = 25


masterAcc = matrix(nrow = iterations, ncol = numks)

for(j in 1:iterations)
{
  train.indices = sample(1:dim(beerclassify)[1],round(split.perc * dim(beerclassify)[1]))
  train = beerclassify[train.indices,]
  test = beerclassify[-train.indices,]
  for(i in 1:numks)
  {
    classifications = knn(train[,c(16,17)],test[,c(16,17)], train$beeripaale, prob = TRUE, k = i)
    table(test$beeripaale, classifications)
    CM = confusionMatrix(table(test$beeripaale,classifications))
    masterAcc[j,i] = CM$overall[1]
  }
  
}

MeanAcc = colMeans(masterAcc)

plot(seq(1,numks,1),MeanAcc, type = "l")

which.max(MeanAcc)
max(MeanAcc)

```
```{r  check correlation within IBU,ABV,Income, population,Ounce}
library("readxl")
library(tidyverse)
library(corrplot)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(ggplot2)
library(GGally)

#check multicorrelation with IBU,ABV,Income,population, ounce

#Replace missing value with mean value
beermerged1<- beermerged
beermerged1$beerABV[which(is.na(beermerged1$beerABV))] <- mean(beermerged1$beerABV,na.rm=TRUE)
beermerged1$beerIBU[which(is.na(beermerged1$beerIBU))] <- mean(beermerged1$beerIBU,na.rm=TRUE)
View(beermerged1)


filterbeermerged <-beermerged1 %>% select(beerIBU,beerABV, beerOunce,Income, Population) 

ggpairs(filterbeermerged, title="correlogram with ggpairs()") 
corrplot(cor(filterbeermerged), type="upper", order="original")

```
